The patient’s blood pressure has improved with the chlorthalidone but she exhibits side effects like urinary frequency and a fine tremor. A change in diuretics may help manage the side effects better, such as switching to a potassium-sparing diuretic or a loop diuretic. Increasing captopril or chlorthalidone dose may further exacerbate the side effects. Ultrasound of the renal arteries is not warranted at this point.
